question1.question:
An Einstein Analytics consultant wants to determine the first day of the week, customize the display labels of fields, and customize colors of charts based on field values.
How can the consultant achieve this?
question1.option1text: By using extended metadata (XMD) to customize the formatting of dataset fields and their values in Analytics dashboards and lenses.
question1.option1textexplanation: Correct. Extended metadata (XMD) enables you to modify dataset fields and their values.
question1.option2text: Create a custom dashboard, and change the attributes in dashboard designer.
question1.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Modifying the labels, days of the week, and customizing colors is not possible through dashboard designer.
question1.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. The JSON defines the components of the dashboard and how they interact.
question1.option4text: Use Einstein REST API to modify these attributes.
question1.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. REST API does not allow users to modify these attributes.

question2.question:
An Einstein Analytics consultant notices their dashboard takes too long to load Salesforce data.
What can an Einstein Analytics user do to improve dashboard performance?
question2.option1text: Run the dashboard from the data that was imported from an Excel sheet.
question2.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. The dashboard performance is not dependent upon what format the data was used to create the dataset.
question2.option2text: Run an efficiency check on the entire org through Einstein Analytics to ensure everything is running efficiently.
question2.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Running an efficiency check on the entire org through Einstein Analytics is not currently a feature.
question2.option3text: Run the dashboards in a separate org, then reconnect the dashboard to the initial org.
question2.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. Running a dashboard in a separate org would separate it from the data.
question2.option4text: Run a performance check on the dashboard and its queries to ensure that everything is running optimally.
question2.option4textexplanation: Correct. When a dashboard design is complete, you run a performance check to ensure the queries and lenses are running optimally.
